name: 101 Dalmatians Quiz | Topics for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Pongo Dalmatian met Perdita Dalmatian at the park. When their humans got married, so did they. How many dalmatians did Roger and Anita have all together if Pongo and Perdita were their only dogs?
questions.explanation:
2.

	The word "altogether" tells you to add the dalmatians to get the answer. The dalmatian gets its name from a place in Austria called Dalmatia.

questions.text: At first, Pongo thinks he has eight puppies. How many more were born for him to have 15 puppies?
questions.explanation:
7.

	I asked how many more, so you would subtract 15-8 and get 7. When a dalmatian is born, it does not have any spots; they come later.

questions.text: Soon, Perdita had puppies. She gave birth to 15 puppies, but sadly one of them died. If she had fifteen and lost one, how many puppies did she have left?
questions.explanation:
14.

	The words "lost" and "left" tell you to subtract, so 15-1 = 14. Dalmatians are often the mascots for firehouses.

questions.text: Jasper and Horace stole the 15 puppies because the one wasn't dead after all! How many are left if there were 17 dalmatians and the 15 puppies are gone?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Since I asked how many are left, you would subtract 17-15 = 2. No two dalmatians have the same pattern of spots.

questions.text: Cruella now has a total of 99 dalmatians. How many dalmatians remain if Pongo and Perdita's 15 are taken away?
questions.explanation:
84.

	When you see the words "how many remain" in a word problem, you will subtract so 99-15=84. Dalmatians have a lot of energy and love being with people.

questions.text: Rolly is on the ice, but Pongo picks him up and takes him away. What is one puppy take away one puppy?
questions.explanation:
0.

	Since you have one puppy and that puppy is taken away, you will subtract 1-1=0.Many dalmatians are deaf - they cannot hear.

questions.text: Some pups are on the ice; three are on one side, and two are on the other. How many pups are there altogether?
questions.explanation:
5.

	The word altogether tells you to add, so 3+2 = 5. Dalmatians tend to be fond of horses.

questions.text: Lucky is cold and doesn't want to keep going while the others have caught up with the rest. If Pongo left him behind, how many would be left of the 99?
questions.explanation:
98.

	Remember, the word left tells you to subtract, so of course, 100 couldn't be the right answer - 99-1=98. Male dalmatians are usually bigger than female dalmatians.

questions.text: Roger and Anita are at the house; two dogs and 15 puppies are missing. Of the 17 dogs that were there, how many are left?
questions.explanation:
0.

	This one is a little tricky. First, you have to add 2+15, which equals 17, to know how many dogs are missing in total; then, you subtract 17 from 17 to determine how many are left. Dalmatians make good watchdogs.

questions.text: All the dalmatians are safe; two adults, 15 original puppies, and 84 new puppies. How many dalmatians in all?
questions.explanation:
101.

	The words in all tell you to add the numbers, this time, you have to add three numbers together 2+15+84 = 101."101 Dalmatians" was Walt Disney's 17th animated movie.
